title: Earthquake hits Pakistan, Afghanistan
author: Amir Zia
text: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan -- An earthquake hit large portions of northern Pakistan and Afghanistan today, shaking several major cities across 400 miles of Central and South Asia. There were no immediate reports of damage or injuries. The magnitude-5.8 quake was centered about 180 miles north of Peshawar, Pakistan, in the Hindu Kush mountain range of Afghanistan -- a frequent source of seismic activity, said Abdul Rashid, seismologist at the Pakistani government's meteorological office. The quake, which struck just after noon, was felt in Islamabad and in Kabul, the Afghan capital, more than 300 miles from Islamabad, heavy shaking was reported. The tremor also was felt in the northern Afghan city of Mazar-e-Sharif. In Islamabad, the quake lasted more than 30 seconds and shook building foundations and light fixtures. In Peshawar, near the Afghan border, the shaking continued more than 10 minutes after the initial  temblor.
